thread.section_title: Albuquerque and New Mexico News, Sports, Business and more | Albuquerque Journal News
thread.title: Special shape balloons take flight
thread.title_full: Special shape balloons take flight | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Robert Browman and Donn Friedman / Of the Journal
title: Special shape balloons take flight
text:
Snap a balloon pic? Submit it to our contest !
Winning pictures will be published in the newspaper, and winning photographers receive a photo session with Kim Jew Portrait Art.
Special shape balloons launch on Thursday. (Donn Friedman/Journal)
9:14 a.m.
Balloons are floating in the air south of Balloon Fiesta Park as competitors attempt to navigate to targets on the field.
8:45 a.m.
Balloons are now drifting south from Balloon Fiesta Park and touching down in neighborhoods west of Jefferson. The field remains open for completion including the key grab until about 10 a.m. as balloons also touch down across the city.
8:17 a.m.
All the special shape balloons have launched and officials are preparing the field for today’s flying competition.
7:47 a.m.
Most balloons taking off from Balloon Fiesta Park are heading north.
7:06 a.m.
Special shapes balloons are starting to lift off the field.
6:55 a.m.
Special shapes balloons are inflating on the field in preparation of today’s mass ascension.
6:40 a.m.
Balloon Fiesta officials are flying the green flag signaling today’s Special Shape Rodeo is a go.
6:35 a.m.
Balloon Fiesta officials said during the pilot’s briefing that winds are light and variable today, and the temperature is 44 degrees on the field.
6:23 a.m.
Thursday Dawn Patrol has launched.
6:18 a.m.
The pilot’s briefing is underway where officials will announce if today’s Special Shape’s Rodeo will launch.
6:03 a.m.
The American Flag balloon is inflating on the field.
5:58 a.m.
Eastbound traffic on Alameda is backed up past the Rio Grande into Balloon Fiesta Park.
5:40 a.m.
Traffic is heavier today than it’s been the past few days. Check our traffic map and consider Park & Ride. Information about Park & Ride is below.
4:55 a.m.
Winds are running 6 mph from the northeast and the temperature is 52 degrees at the Albuquerque International Sunport.
Schedule
Todays’s Balloon Fiesta schedule:
Morning Session
6:00 a.m. – Dawn Patrol Show
6:00 a.m. – Laser Light Show
7:00 a.m. – Special Shape Rodeo™
8:00 a.m. – Flying Competition begins
8:30 a.m. – Chainsaw Carving Invitational until 11:30 am
9:00 a.m. – Main Stage Musical Performance
9:45 a.m. – Parabatix Sky Racers
Evening Session
1:30 p.m. – Chainsaw Carving Invitational until 5 p.m.
4:00 p.m. – Parabatix Sky Racers
4:30 p.m. – Main Stage Musical Performance
6:00 p.m. – Special Shape Glowdeo™
7:30 p.m. – Laser Light Show
7:30 p.m. – Main Stage Musical Performance
8:00 p.m. – AfterGlow™ Fireworks Show, presented in part by the Albuquerque Journal
Getting there
Traffic is expected to be heavy on I-25 northbound and southbound, and on Tramway and Alameda approaching Balloon Fiesta Park. Check our Balloon Fiesta traffic map for current traffic speeds.
Park & Ride is always running. Here are the locations:
East Side
– Hoffmantown Church – 8888 Harper Road NE, Park in the northeast lot only.
– Cliff’s Amusement Park – 4800 Osuna Road NE near San Mateo and I-25.
– Coronado Mall – 6600 Menaul Boulevard NE, park in the southwest corner near San Pedro.
West Side
– Intel (southern parking lot) – Highway 528/Rio Rancho Blvd. Enter the Park & Ride lot at either Westside Blvd. or 21st street and follow the signs.
– Cottonwood Mall (northeast parking lot) – located at 10000 Coors Bypass near Seven Bar Loop.
Park & Ride prices
Same-day purchase at Park & Ride locations. Balloon Park admission and service charge is included.
– Adults & Seniors (13 and up) – $20
– Children (6-12) – $10
– Children (5 and under) – Free
*Note: There will be no Park & Ride service on Monday, Tuesday or Wednesday.
